THESE STATEMENTS HAVE NOT BEEN EVALUATED BY THE FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION. THIS PRODUCT IS NOT INTENDED TO DIAGNOSE, TREAT, CURE OR PREVENT ANY DISEASE."
perturbation.changed_text: In connection with any ESSI's usage of Talent Attributes as outlined above in Paragraphs 3(A)-(D) that are applicable to Dietary Supplements, ESSI may choose to feature a disclaimer.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the mandatory disclaimer related to FDA evaluation of dietary supplements. Federal law requires specific disclaimers on dietary supplements; removing this requirement makes the contract non-compliant and increases the risk of misleading consumers.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 21 U.S. Code ยง 343 - Misbranded food

perturbation.original_text: ESSI's products are, and will remain, merchantable and fit for the purpose for which they are intended, and B. ESSI's products do, and will, conform at all times to all applicable federal, state and local laws, rules, regulations, ordinances, and other enactments and industry standards, including, but not limited to, those relating to product safety.
perturbation.changed_text: ESSI's products are, and will remain, fit for the purpose for which they are intended. ESSI's products will conform to company standards.
perturbation.explanation: This change omits the warranty that ESSI's products conform to all applicable federal, state and local laws, rules, regulations, ordinances, and other enactments and industry standards, including, but not limited to, those relating to product safety. By removing the guarantee of compliance with laws and safety regulations, ESSI significantly reduces its liability and creates a contradiction with implied warranties and consumer protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Michigan Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Implied Warranty of Merchantability and Fitness for a Particular Purpose, Consumer Product Safety Act (CPSA)

perturbation.original_text: ESSI hereby agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless Talent, his agents, representatives and employees (referred to collectively as "Talent Indemnities") from and against any and all claims, actions, causes of action, damages, injuries, expenses, liabilities (joint and several), penalties fines, attorney fees, court costs, and any other expenses incurred by Talent Indemnities arising out of (1) breach by ESSI of any of the terms, representations or warranties made by ESSI in this Agreement; or (2) ESSI product liability or trademark patent or other proprietary right infringement; or (3) errors, omissions, fraudulent or negligent acts by ESSI, its employees, agents or subcontractors in connection with (i) any advertising featuring Talent; (ii) with the performance of ESSI's duties and obligations under this Agreement; (iii) with the production, distribution, promotion, marketing and sales of products including related product packaging; and/or (iv) with the operation and management of its production and distribution facilities, however caused.
perturbation.changed_text: ESSI agrees to indemnify Talent from direct damages arising solely from ESSI's breach of this agreement, limited to the amount of fees paid to Talent under this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This significantly reduces ESSI's indemnity obligations to Talent. The original clause provided broad indemnification for various liabilities, including product liability and infringement claims. The modified clause limits indemnification to direct damages from breach of contract and caps the liability at the fees paid to Talent. This omission contradicts the standard practice of broad indemnification in endorsement agreements and increases the legal risk for Talent, potentially conflicting with Michigan law regarding indemnification obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common law principles regarding indemnification; Michigan contract law regarding reasonable expectations of parties.
